title: Credits font for Masters of Sex
content:
A sharp geometric font. Horizontal strokes that are normally around x-height are lowered. Used in context with a 60s themed television show "Masters of Sex."

I think it almost 100% matches Neutraface but the /t/ in the picture doesn't have as tall an ascender as the sample text on the website (Neutra Display Bold):  
 [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153232/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface")

Thanks in advance

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153232im_/http:/typophile.com/files/x_5716.jpg)
author: dontbugme

comments.content: I think **[Neutra Text Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153232/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=House-Industries&ffam=Neutra%20Text%20-%20Bold&fid=eb0d8608899917f5275c0fce9809772f&fsize=60&text=SHOWTIME%20Presents&wrap=2)** is a fine match (including the /t)
